verbs.description: laicize (third-person singular simple present laicizes, present participle laicizing, simple past and past participle laicized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To convert from church-controlled to independent of the church; to secularize.
examples: They will laicise each of the schools in the district.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To reduce from clergy to layman.
examples: Due to his controversial views the Vatican decided to laicise the priest.
The soup kitchen laicised, it moved out of the church and registered as an independent non-profit.
